static double edu.ou.asgbook.oban.ObjectiveAnalysisUtils.computeMeanDistance ( PointObservations  data  )  [static] 

00060                                                                      {
00061         PointObservations.ObservationPoint[] points = data.getPoints();
00062         if ( points.length < 1 ){
00063             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Number of points has be greater than one");
00064         }
00065         
00066         double totdist = 0;
00067         for (int i=0; i < points.length; ++i){
00068             double mindistsq = Double.MAX_VALUE;
00069             for (int j=0; j < points.length; ++j){
00070                 if ( j != i ){
00071                     double latdist = points[i].getLat() - points[j].getLat();
00072                     double londist = points[i].getLon() - points[j].getLon();
00073                     double distsq = (latdist*latdist + londist*londist);
00074                     if ( distsq < mindistsq ){
00075                         mindistsq = distsq;
00076                     }
00077                 }
00078             }
00079             totdist += Math.sqrt(mindistsq);
00080         }
00081         
00082         return totdist / points.length;
00083     }

static LatLonGrid edu.ou.asgbook.oban.ObjectiveAnalysisUtils.createBoundingGrid ( PointObservations  data,
double  latres,
double  lonres 
) [static] 

00017                                                                                                      {      
00018         PointObservations.ObservationPoint[] points = data.getPoints();
00019         if ( points.length == 0 ){
00020             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Number of points has be greater than zero");
00021         }
00022         
00023         // find bounding box
00024         double minlat = 90;
00025         double maxlat = -90;
00026         double minlon = 180;
00027         double maxlon = -180;
00028         for (int i=0; i < points.length; ++i){
00029             if (points[i].getLat() > maxlat){
00030                 maxlat = points[i].getLat();
00031             }
00032             if (points[i].getLat() < minlat){
00033                 minlat = points[i].getLat(); 
00034             }
00035             if (points[i].getLon() > maxlon){
00036                 maxlon = points[i].getLon();
00037             }
00038             if (points[i].getLon() < minlon){
00039                 minlon = points[i].getLon();
00040             }
00041         }
00042         
00043         // go a little bit off to the side and roundoff so that grid bounds are multiples of res
00044         minlat = round(minlat - latres, latres);
00045         maxlat = round(maxlat + latres, latres);
00046         minlon = round(minlon - lonres, lonres);
00047         maxlon = round(maxlon + lonres, lonres);
00048         
00049         int nrows = (int) Math.round((maxlat - minlat)/latres);
00050         int ncols = (int) Math.round((maxlon - minlon)/lonres);
00051         
00052         System.out.println(points.length + " points will fit inside a " + nrows + "x" + ncols + " grid");
00053         return new LatLonGrid(nrows, ncols, data.getMissing(), new LatLon(maxlat,minlon), latres, lonres);
00054     }
